wikipedia_page.main: Jennifer Dawson, (24 January 1929 – 14 October 2000) was an English novelist. Her works explored the theme of mental illness and society's attitudes to those suffering from such conditions.

response: *James Tait Black Memorial Prize for fiction: Jennifer Dawson, The Ha-Ha
*Jennifer Dawson's 1961 novel The Ha-Ha is named for this landscape feature.
| 1961 || Jennifer Dawson, The Ha-Ha ||	M. K. Ashby, Joseph Ashby of Tysoe (Joseph Ashby) ||
